intro: Guatteria sylvicola, commonly known as the silverleaf guatteria, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Its leaves are usually革质 (leathery) and have a distinctive silvery underside, contributing to its common name. Guatteria sylvicola produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by edible, berry-like fruits.
